appcompat_shims.description: Application Compatibility shims are a way to persist malware. This table presents the AppCompat Shim information from the registry in a nice format. See http://files.brucon.org/2015/Tomczak_and_Ballenthin_Shims_for_the_Win.pdf for more details.
columns: This is the path to the SDB database.

windows_optional_features.description: Lists names and installation states of windows features. Maps to Win32_OptionalFeature WMI class.
columns: Caption of feature in settings UI

powershell_events.description: Powershell script blocks reconstructed to their full script content, this table requires script block logging to be enabled.
columns: Timestamp the event was received by the osquery event publisher
System time at which the Powershell script event occurred
The total number of script blocks for this script
The text content of the Powershell script
The name of the Powershell script
The path for the Powershell script

winbaseobj.description: Lists named Windows objects in the default object directories, across all terminal services sessions.

cpu_info.description: Retrieve cpu hardware info of the machine.
columns: The processor type, such as Central, Math, or Video.
The availability and status of the CPU.
The current operating status of the CPU.
The number of cores of the CPU.
The number of logical processors of the CPU.
The width of the CPU address bus.
The current frequency of the CPU.
The maximum possible frequency of the CPU.
The assigned socket on the board for the given CPU.

wmi_bios_info.description: Lists important information from the system bios.

programs.description: Represents products as they are installed by Windows Installer. A product generally correlates to one installation package on Windows. Some fields may be blank as Windows installation details are left to the discretion of the product author.
columns: The installation location directory of the product.
The installation source of the product.
Path and filename of the uninstaller.
Date that this product was installed on the system.

wmi_script_event_consumers.description: WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumer, which can be used for persistence on Windows. See https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-15/materials/us-15-Graeber-Abusing-Windows-Management-Instrumentation-WMI-To-Build-A-Persistent%20Asynchronous-And-Fileless-Backdoor-wp.pdf for more details.
columns: Unique identifier for the event consumer.
Relative path to the class or instance.

hvci_status.description: Retrieve HVCI info of the machine.
columns: The version number of the Device Guard build.
The instance ID of Device Guard.

physical_disk_performance.description: Provides provides raw data from performance counters that monitor hard or fixed disk drives on the system.

autoexec.description: Aggregate of executables that will automatically
columns: Source table of the autoexec item
1 if the variable needs expanding, 0 otherwise

bitlocker_info.description: Retrieve bitlocker status of the machine.
columns: Drive letter of the encrypted drive.
The bitlocker conversion status of the drive.
The bitlocker protection status of the drive.
The encryption type of the device.
The FVE metadata version of the drive.
The percentage of the drive that is encrypted.
The accessibility status of the drive from Windows.

connectivity.description: Provides the overall system's network state.
columns: True if the all interfaces are not connected to any network
True if any interface is connected to the local subnet via IPv4
True if any interface is connected to a routed network via IPv4
True if any interface is connected to the Internet via IPv4
True if any interface is connected to the local subnet via IPv6
True if any interface is connected to a routed network via IPv6
True if any interface is connected to the Internet via IPv6
Type of address. One of dhcp, manual, auto, other, unknown
The friendly display name of the interface.
The friendly display name of the interface.

arp_cache.description: Address resolution cache, both static and dynamic (from ARP, NDP).
columns: Interface of the network for the MAC
1 if CA: true (certificate is an authority) else 0
Key size used for RSA/DSA, or curve name
Certificate key usage and extended key usage
SHA1 hash of the raw certificate contents

startup_items.description: Applications and binaries set as user/login startup items.
columns: Directory or plist containing startup item
Startup status; either enabled or disabled
The user associated with the startup item

cpuid.description: Useful CPU features from the cpuid ASM call.
columns: Register used to for feature value
Bit in register value for feature value

atom_packages.description: Lists all atom packages in a directory or globally installed in a system.

curl_certificate.description: Inspect TLS certificates by connecting to input hostnames.
columns: Common name of company issued to

osquery_flags.description: Configurable flags that modify osquery's behavior.

columns: The transient ID assigned for communication
osquery SDK version used to build the extension
Path of the extenion's domain socket or library path
SDK extension type: extension or module

osquery_events.description: Information about the event publishers and subscribers.
columns: Publisher only: number of runloop restarts

osquery_info.description: Top level information about the running version of osquery.
columns: Unique ID provided by the system
Unique, long-lived ID per instance of osquery
Hash of the working configuration state
1 if the config was loaded and considered valid, else 0
osquery toolkit platform distribution name (os version)
UNIX time in seconds when the process started
Process (or thread/handle) ID of optional watcher process
1 If the plugin is internal else 0
1 If this plugin is active else 0

time.description: Track current date and time in the system.
columns: Current local timezone in the system
Current timestamp (log format) in the system
Current time (ISO format) in the system

osquery_schedule.description: Information about the current queries that are scheduled in osquery.
columns: The given name for this query
Number of times the query was executed
1 if the query is blacklisted else 0
1 if the path is a symlink, otherwise 0

osquery_packs.description: Information about the current query packs that are loaded in osquery.
columns: The given name for this query pack
Platforms this query is supported on
Minimum osquery version that this query will run on
Shard restriction limit, 1-100, 0 meaning no restriction
